32using MaybeVariable = base::Optional<Variable>;
33
34V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE int CountDecimalDigits(uint32_t value);
35struct PaddingSpace {
36 int spaces;
37};
38V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
39 PaddingSpace padding);

41template <typename Next>
42class ReducerBaseForwarder;
43template <typename Next>
44class WasmRevecReducer;
45
46template <typename Derived, typename Base>
47class OutputGraphAssembler : public Base {
48#define FRIEND(op) friend struct op##Op;
49 TURBOSHAFT_OPERATION_LIST(FRIEND)
50#undef FRIEND
51 template <size_t I, class D>
52 friend struct FixedArityOperationT;
53
54 OpIndex Map(OpIndex index) { return derived_this()->MapToNewGraph(index); }
55
56 OptionalOpIndex Map(OptionalOpIndex index) {
57 return derived_this()->MapToNewGraph(index);
58 }
59
60 template <size_t N>
61 base::SmallVector<OpIndex, N> Map(base::Vector<const OpIndex> indices) {
62 return derived_this()->template MapToNewGraph<N>(indices);
63 }
64
65 public:
66#define ASSEMBLE(operation) \
67 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraph##operation(const operation##Op& op) { \
68 return op.Explode( \
69 [a = assembler()](auto... args) { \
70 return a->Reduce##operation(args...); \
71 }, \
72 *this); \
73 }
74 TURBOSHAFT_OPERATION_LIST(ASSEMBLE)
75#undef ASSEMBLE
76
77 private:
78 Derived* derived_this() { return static_cast<Derived*>(this); }
79 Assembler<typename Base::ReducerList>* assembler() {
80 return &derived_this()->Asm();
81 }
82};
83
84template <class AfterNext>
85class GraphVisitor : public OutputGraphAssembler<GraphVisitor<AfterNext>,
86 VariableReducer<AfterNext>> {
87 template <typename N>
88 friend class ReducerBaseForwarder;
89 template <typename N>
90 friend class WasmRevecReducer;
91
92 public:
93 using Next = VariableReducer<AfterNext>;
94 TURBOSHAFT_REDUCER_BOILERPLATE(CopyingPhase)
95
96 GraphVisitor()
97 : input_graph_(Asm().modifiable_input_graph()),
98 current_input_block_(nullptr),
99 op_mapping_(Asm().input_graph().op_id_count(), OpIndex::Invalid(),
100 Asm().phase_zone(), &Asm().input_graph()),
101 block_mapping_(Asm().input_graph().block_count(), nullptr,
102 Asm().phase_zone()),
103 blocks_needing_variables_(Asm().input_graph().block_count(),
104 Asm().phase_zone()),
105 old_opindex_to_variables(Asm().input_graph().op_id_count(),
106 Asm().phase_zone(), &Asm().input_graph()),
107 blocks_to_clone_(Asm().phase_zone()) {
108 Asm().output_graph().Reset();
109 }
110
111 // `trace_reduction` is a template parameter to avoid paying for tracing at
112 // runtime.
113 template <bool trace_reduction>
114 void VisitGraph() {
115 Asm().Analyze();
116
117 // Creating initial old-to-new Block mapping.
118 for (Block& input_block : Asm().modifiable_input_graph().blocks()) {
119 block_mapping_[input_block.index()] = Asm().output_graph().NewBlock(
120 input_block.IsLoop() ? Block::Kind::kLoopHeader : Block::Kind::kMerge,
121 &input_block);
122 }
123
124 // Visiting the graph.
125 VisitAllBlocks<trace_reduction>();
126
127 Finalize();
128 }
129
130 void Bind(Block* block) {
131 Next::Bind(block);
132 block->SetOrigin(current_input_block());
133 }
134
135 void Finalize() {
136 // Updating the source_positions.
137 if (!Asm().input_graph().source_positions().empty()) {
138 for (OpIndex index : Asm().output_graph().AllOperationIndices()) {
139 OpIndex origin = Asm().output_graph().operation_origins()[index];
140 Asm().output_graph().source_positions()[index] =
141 Asm().input_graph().source_positions()[origin];
142 }
143 }
144 // Updating the operation origins.
145 NodeOriginTable* origins = Asm().data()->node_origins();
146 if (origins) {
147 for (OpIndex index : Asm().output_graph().AllOperationIndices()) {
148 OpIndex origin = Asm().output_graph().operation_origins()[index];
149 origins->SetNodeOrigin(index.id(), origin.id());
150 }
151 }
152
153 input_graph_.SwapWithCompanion();
154 }
155
156 const Block* current_input_block() { return current_input_block_; }
157
158 bool* turn_loop_without_backedge_into_merge() {
159 return &turn_loop_without_backedge_into_merge_;
160 }
161
162 // Emits a Goto to a cloned version of {input_block}, assuming that the only
163 // predecessor of this cloned copy will be the current block. {input_block} is
164 // not cloned right away (because this would recursively call VisitBlockBody,
165 // which could cause stack overflows), and is instead added to the
166 // {blocks_to_clone_} stack, whose blocks will be cloned once the current
167 // block has been fully visited.
168 void CloneBlockAndGoto(const Block* input_block) {
169 Block* new_block =
170 Asm().output_graph().NewBlock(input_block->kind(), input_block);
171
172 // Computing which input of Phi operations to use when visiting
173 // {input_block} (since {input_block} doesn't really have predecessors
174 // anymore).
175 int added_block_phi_input = input_block->GetPredecessorIndex(
176 Asm().current_block()->OriginForBlockEnd());
177
178 // There is no guarantees that {input_block} will be entirely removed just
179 // because it's cloned/inlined, since it's possible that it has predecessors
180 // for which this optimization didn't apply. As a result, we add it to
181 // {blocks_needing_variables_}, so that if it's ever generated
182 // normally, Variables are used when emitting its content, so that
183 // they can later be merged when control flow merges with the current
184 // version of {input_block} that we just cloned.
185 blocks_needing_variables_.Add(input_block->index().id());
186
187 Asm().Goto(new_block);
188
189 blocks_to_clone_.push_back({input_block, added_block_phi_input, new_block});
190 }
191
192 // Visits and emits {input_block} right now (ie, in the current block). This
193 // should not be called recursively in order to avoid stack overflow (ie,
194 // processing {input_block} should never lead to calling CloneAndInlingBlock).
195 void CloneAndInlineBlock(const Block* input_block) {
196 if (Asm().generating_unreachable_operations()) return;
197
198#ifdef DEBUG
199 // Making sure that we didn't call CloneAndInlineBlock recursively.
200 DCHECK(!is_in_recursive_inlining_);
201 ScopedModification<bool> recursive_guard(&is_in_recursive_inlining_, true);
202#endif
203
204 // Computing which input of Phi operations to use when visiting
205 // {input_block} (since {input_block} doesn't really have predecessors
206 // anymore).
207 int added_block_phi_input = input_block->GetPredecessorIndex(
208 Asm().current_block()->OriginForBlockEnd());
209
210 // There is no guarantees that {input_block} will be entirely removed just
211 // because it's cloned/inlined, since it's possible that it has predecessors
212 // for which this optimization didn't apply. As a result, we add it to
213 // {blocks_needing_variables_}, so that if it's ever generated
214 // normally, Variables are used when emitting its content, so that
215 // they can later be merged when control flow merges with the current
216 // version of {input_block} that we just cloned.
217 blocks_needing_variables_.Add(input_block->index().id());
218
219 ScopedModification<bool> set_true(&current_block_needs_variables_, true);
220 VisitBlockBody<CanHavePhis::kYes, ForCloning::kYes, false>(
221 input_block, added_block_phi_input);
222 }
223
224 // {InlineOp} introduces two limitations unlike {CloneAndInlineBlock}:
225 // 1. The input operation must not be emitted anymore as part of its
226 // regular input block;
227 // 2. {InlineOp} must not be used multiple times for the same input op.
228 bool InlineOp(OpIndex index, const Block* input_block) {
229 return VisitOpAndUpdateMapping<false>(index, input_block);
230 }
231
232 template <bool can_be_invalid = false>
233 OpIndex MapToNewGraph(OpIndex old_index, int predecessor_index = -1) {
234 DCHECK(old_index.valid());
235 OpIndex result = op_mapping_[old_index];
236
237 if (!result.valid()) {
238 // {op_mapping} doesn't have a mapping for {old_index}. The
239 // VariableReducer should provide the mapping.
240 MaybeVariable var = GetVariableFor(old_index);
241 if constexpr (can_be_invalid) {
242 if (!var.has_value()) {
243 return OpIndex::Invalid();
244 }
245 }
246 DCHECK(var.has_value());
247 if (predecessor_index == -1) {
248 result = Asm().GetVariable(var.value());
249 } else {
250 result = Asm().GetPredecessorValue(var.value(), predecessor_index);
251 }
252 }
253
254 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!can_be_invalid, result.valid());
255 return result;
256 }
257
258 template <bool can_be_invalid = false, typename T>
259 V<T> MapToNewGraph(V<T> old_index, int predecessor_index = -1) {
260 return V<T>::Cast(MapToNewGraph(static_cast<OpIndex>(old_index), -1));
261 }
262
263 Block* MapToNewGraph(const Block* block) const {
264 Block* new_block = block_mapping_[block->index()];
265 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(new_block);
266 return new_block;
267 }
268
269 template <typename FunctionType>
270 OpIndex ResolvePhi(const PhiOp& op, FunctionType&& map,
271 RegisterRepresentation rep) {
272 if (op.input_count == 1) {
273 // If, in the previous CopyingPhase, a loop header was turned into a
274 // regular blocks, its PendingLoopPhis became Phis with a single input. We
275 // can now just get rid of these Phis.
276 return map(op.input(0), -1);
277 }
278
279 OpIndex ig_index = Asm().input_graph().Index(op);
280 if (Asm().current_block()->IsLoop()) {
281 DCHECK_EQ(op.input_count, 2);
282 OpIndex og_index = map(op.input(0), -1);
283 if (ig_index == op.input(PhiOp::kLoopPhiBackEdgeIndex)) {
284 // Avoid emitting a Loop Phi which points to itself, instead
285 // emit it's 0'th input.
286 return og_index;
287 }
288 return Asm().PendingLoopPhi(og_index, rep);
289 }
290
291 base::Vector<const OpIndex> old_inputs = op.inputs();
292 base::SmallVector<OpIndex, 64> new_inputs;
293 int predecessor_count = Asm().current_block()->PredecessorCount();
294 Block* old_pred = current_input_block_->LastPredecessor();
295 Block* new_pred = Asm().current_block()->LastPredecessor();
296 // Control predecessors might be missing after the optimization phase. So we
297 // need to skip phi inputs that belong to control predecessors that have no
298 // equivalent in the new graph.
299
300 // We first assume that the order if the predecessors of the current block
301 // did not change. If it did, {new_pred} won't be nullptr at the end of this
302 // loop, and we'll instead fall back to the slower code below to compute the
303 // inputs of the Phi.
304 int predecessor_index = predecessor_count - 1;
305 for (OpIndex input : base::Reversed(old_inputs)) {
306 if (new_pred && new_pred->OriginForBlockEnd() == old_pred) {
307 // Phis inputs have to come from predecessors. We thus have to
308 // MapToNewGraph with {predecessor_index} so that we get an OpIndex that
309 // is from a predecessor rather than one that comes from a Variable
310 // merged in the current block.
311 new_inputs.push_back(map(input, predecessor_index));
312 new_pred = new_pred->NeighboringPredecessor();
313 predecessor_index--;
314 }
315 old_pred = old_pred->NeighboringPredecessor();
316 }
317 DCHECK_IMPLIES(new_pred == nullptr, old_pred == nullptr);
318
319 if (new_pred != nullptr) {
320 // If {new_pred} is not nullptr, then the order of the predecessors
321 // changed. This should only happen with blocks that were introduced in
322 // the previous graph. For instance, consider this (partial) dominator
323 // tree:
324 //
325 // 7
326 // 8
327 // 10
328 // 9
329 // 11
330 //
331 // Where the predecessors of block 11 are blocks 9 and 10 (in that order).
332 // In dominator visit order, block 10 will be visited before block 9.
333 // Since blocks are added to predecessors when the predecessors are
334 // visited, it means that in the new graph, the predecessors of block 11
335 // are [10, 9] rather than [9, 10].
336 // To account for this, we reorder the inputs of the Phi, and get rid of
337 // inputs from blocks that vanished.
338
339#ifdef DEBUG
340 // To check that indices are set properly, we zap them in debug builds.
341 for (auto& block : Asm().modifiable_input_graph().blocks()) {
342 block.clear_custom_data();
343 }
344#endif
345 uint32_t pos = current_input_block_->PredecessorCount() - 1;
346 for (old_pred = current_input_block_->LastPredecessor();
347 old_pred != nullptr; old_pred = old_pred->NeighboringPredecessor()) {
348 // Store the current index of the {old_pred}.
349 old_pred->set_custom_data(pos--, Block::CustomDataKind::kPhiInputIndex);
350 }
351
352 // Filling {new_inputs}: we iterate the new predecessors, and, for each
353 // predecessor, we check the index of the input corresponding to the old
354 // predecessor, and we put it next in {new_inputs}.
355 new_inputs.clear();
356 int predecessor_index = predecessor_count - 1;
357 for (new_pred = Asm().current_block()->LastPredecessor();
358 new_pred != nullptr; new_pred = new_pred->NeighboringPredecessor()) {
359 const Block* origin = new_pred->OriginForBlockEnd();
360 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(origin);
361 OpIndex input = old_inputs[origin->get_custom_data(
362 Block::CustomDataKind::kPhiInputIndex)];
363 // Phis inputs have to come from predecessors. We thus have to
364 // MapToNewGraph with {predecessor_index} so that we get an OpIndex that
365 // is from a predecessor rather than one that comes from a Variable
366 // merged in the current block.
367 new_inputs.push_back(map(input, predecessor_index));
368 predecessor_index--;
369 }
370 }
371
372 DCHECK_EQ(new_inputs.size(), Asm().current_block()->PredecessorCount());
373
374 if (new_inputs.size() == 1) {
375 // This Operation used to be a Phi in a Merge, but since one (or more) of
376 // the inputs of the merge have been removed, there is no need for a Phi
377 // anymore.
378 return new_inputs[0];
379 }
380
381 std::reverse(new_inputs.begin(), new_inputs.end());
382 return Asm().ReducePhi(base::VectorOf(new_inputs), rep);
383 }
384
385 // The block from the input graph that corresponds to the current block as a
386 // branch destination. Such a block might not exist, and this function uses a
387 // trick to compute such a block in almost all cases, but might rarely fail
388 // and return `nullptr` instead.
389 const Block* OriginForBlockStart(Block* block) const {
390 // Check that `block->origin_` is still valid as a block start and was not
391 // changed to a semantically different block when inlining blocks.
392 const Block* origin = block->origin_;
393 if (origin && MapToNewGraph(origin) == block) return origin;
394 return nullptr;
395 }
396
397 // Clone all of the blocks in {sub_graph} (which should be Blocks of the input
398 // graph). If `keep_loop_kinds` is true, the loop headers are preserved, and
399 // otherwise they are marked as Merge. An initial GotoOp jumping to the 1st
400 // block of `sub_graph` is always emitted. The output Block corresponding to
401 // the 1st block of `sub_graph` is returned.
402 template <class Set>
403 Block* CloneSubGraph(Set sub_graph, bool keep_loop_kinds,
404 bool is_loop_after_peeling = false) {
405 // The BlockIndex of the blocks of `sub_graph` should be sorted so that
406 // visiting them in order is correct (all of the predecessors of a block
407 // should always be visited before the block itself).
408 DCHECK(std::is_sorted(sub_graph.begin(), sub_graph.end(),
409 [](const Block* a, const Block* b) {
410 return a->index().id() <= b->index().id();
411 }));
412
413 // 1. Create new blocks, and update old->new mapping. This is required to
414 // emit multiple times the blocks of {sub_graph}: if a block `B1` in
415 // {sub_graph} ends with a Branch/Goto to a block `B2` that is also in
416 // {sub_graph}, then this Branch/Goto should go to the version of `B2` that
417 // this CloneSubGraph will insert, rather than to a version inserted by a
418 // previous call to CloneSubGraph or the version that the regular
419 // VisitAllBlock function will emit.
420 ZoneVector<Block*> old_mappings(sub_graph.size(), Asm().phase_zone());
421 for (auto&& [input_block, old_mapping] :
422 base::zip(sub_graph, old_mappings)) {
423 old_mapping = block_mapping_[input_block->index()];
424 Block::Kind kind = keep_loop_kinds && input_block->IsLoop()
425 ? Block::Kind::kLoopHeader
426 : Block::Kind::kMerge;
427 block_mapping_[input_block->index()] =
428 Asm().output_graph().NewBlock(kind, input_block);
429 }
430
431 // 2. Visit block in correct order (begin to end)
432
433 // Emit a goto to 1st block.
434 Block* start = block_mapping_[(*sub_graph.begin())->index()];
435#ifdef DEBUG
436 if (is_loop_after_peeling) start->set_has_peeled_iteration();
437#endif
438 Asm().Goto(start);
439 // Visiting `sub_graph`.
440 for (const Block* block : sub_graph) {
441 blocks_needing_variables_.Add(block->index().id());
442 VisitBlock<false>(block);
443 ProcessWaitingCloningAndInlining<false>();
444 }
445
446 // 3. Restore initial old->new mapping
447 for (auto&& [input_block, old_mapping] :
448 base::zip(sub_graph, old_mappings)) {
449 block_mapping_[input_block->index()] = old_mapping;
450 }
451
452 return start;
453 }
454
455 template <bool can_be_invalid = false>
456 OptionalOpIndex MapToNewGraph(OptionalOpIndex old_index,
457 int predecessor_index = -1) {
458 if (!old_index.has_value()) return OptionalOpIndex::Nullopt();
459 return MapToNewGraph<can_be_invalid>(old_index.value(), predecessor_index);
460 }
461
462 template <size_t expected_size>
463 base::SmallVector<OpIndex, expected_size> MapToNewGraph(
464 base::Vector<const OpIndex> inputs) {
465 base::SmallVector<OpIndex, expected_size> result;
466 for (OpIndex input : inputs) {
467 result.push_back(MapToNewGraph(input));
468 }
469 return result;
470 }
471
472 private:
473 template <bool trace_reduction>
474 void VisitAllBlocks() {
475 base::SmallVector<const Block*, 128> visit_stack;
476
477 visit_stack.push_back(&Asm().input_graph().StartBlock());
478 while (!visit_stack.empty()) {
479 const Block* block = visit_stack.back();
480 visit_stack.pop_back();
481 VisitBlock<trace_reduction>(block);
482 ProcessWaitingCloningAndInlining<trace_reduction>();
483
484 for (Block* child = block->LastChild(); child != nullptr;
485 child = child->NeighboringChild()) {
486 visit_stack.push_back(child);
487 }
488 }
489 }
490
491 template <bool trace_reduction>
492 void VisitBlock(const Block* input_block) {
493 current_block_needs_variables_ =
494 blocks_needing_variables_.Contains(input_block->index().id());
495 if constexpr (trace_reduction) {
496 std::cout << "\nold " << PrintAsBlockHeader{*input_block} << "\n";
497 std::cout << "new "
498 << PrintAsBlockHeader{*MapToNewGraph(input_block),
499 Asm().output_graph().next_block_index()}
500 << "\n";
501 }
502 Block* new_block = MapToNewGraph(input_block);
503 if (Asm().Bind(new_block)) {
504 VisitBlockBody<CanHavePhis::kYes, ForCloning::kNo, trace_reduction>(
505 input_block);
506 if constexpr (trace_reduction) TraceBlockFinished();
507 } else {
508 if constexpr (trace_reduction) TraceBlockUnreachable();
509 }
510
511 // If we eliminate a loop backedge, we need to turn the loop into a
512 // single-predecessor merge block.
513 if (!turn_loop_without_backedge_into_merge_) return;
514 const Operation& last_op = input_block->LastOperation(Asm().input_graph());
515 if (auto* final_goto = last_op.TryCast<GotoOp>()) {
516 if (final_goto->destination->IsLoop()) {
517 if (input_block->index() >= final_goto->destination->index()) {
518 Asm().FinalizeLoop(MapToNewGraph(final_goto->destination));
519 } else {
520 // We have a forward jump to a loop, rather than a backedge. We
521 // don't need to do anything.
522 }
523 }
524 }
525 }
526
527 enum class CanHavePhis { kNo, kYes };
528 enum class ForCloning { kNo, kYes };
529
530 template <CanHavePhis can_have_phis, ForCloning for_cloning,
531 bool trace_reduction>
532 void VisitBlockBody(const Block* input_block,
533 int added_block_phi_input = -1) {
534 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(Asm().current_block());
535 current_input_block_ = input_block;
536
537 // Phis could be mutually recursive, for instance (in a loop header):
538 //
539 // p1 = phi(a, p2)
540 // p2 = phi(b, p1)
541 //
542 // In this case, if we are currently unrolling the loop and visiting this
543 // loop header that is now part of the loop body, then if we visit Phis
544 // and emit new mapping (with CreateOldToNewMapping) as we go along, we
545 // would visit p1 and emit a mapping saying "p1 = p2", and use this
546 // mapping when visiting p2, then we'd map p2 to p2 instead of p1. To
547 // overcome this issue, we first visit the Phis of the loop, emit the new
548 // phis, and record the new mapping in a side-table ({new_phi_values}).
549 // Then, we visit all of the operations of the loop and commit the new
550 // mappings: phis were emitted before using the old mapping, and all of
551 // the other operations will use the new mapping (as they should).
552 //
553 // Note that Phis are not always at the begining of blocks, but when they
554 // aren't, they can't have inputs from the current block (except on their
555 // backedge for loop phis, but they start as PendingLoopPhis without
556 // backedge input), so visiting all Phis first is safe.
557
558 // Visiting Phis and collecting their new OpIndices.
559 base::SmallVector<OpIndex, 64> new_phi_values;
560 if constexpr (can_have_phis == CanHavePhis::kYes) {
561 for (OpIndex index : Asm().input_graph().OperationIndices(*input_block)) {
562 if (ShouldSkipOperation(Asm().input_graph().Get(index))) continue;
563 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(Asm().current_block());
564 if (Asm().input_graph().Get(index).template Is<PhiOp>()) {
565 OpIndex new_index;
566 if constexpr (for_cloning == ForCloning::kYes) {
567 // When cloning a block, it only has a single predecessor, and Phis
568 // should therefore be removed and be replaced by the input
569 // corresponding to this predecessor.
570 DCHECK_NE(added_block_phi_input, -1);
571 // This Phi has been cloned/inlined, and has thus now a single
572 // predecessor, and shouldn't be a Phi anymore.
573 new_index = MapToNewGraph(
574 Asm().input_graph().Get(index).input(added_block_phi_input));
575 } else {
576 new_index =
577 VisitOpNoMappingUpdate<trace_reduction>(index, input_block);
578 }
579 new_phi_values.push_back(new_index);
580 if (!Asm().current_block()) {
581 // A reducer has detected, based on the Phis of the block that were
582 // visited so far, that we are in unreachable code (or, less likely,
583 // decided, based on some Phis only, to jump away from this block?).
584 return;
585 }
586 }
587 }
588 }
589 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(Asm().current_block());
590
591 // Visiting everything, updating Phi mappings, and emitting non-phi
592 // operations.
593 int phi_num = 0;
594 bool stopped_early = false;
595 for (OpIndex index : base::IterateWithoutLast(
596 Asm().input_graph().OperationIndices(*input_block))) {
597 if (ShouldSkipOperation(Asm().input_graph().Get(index))) continue;
598 const Operation& op = Asm().input_graph().Get(index);
599 if constexpr (can_have_phis == CanHavePhis::kYes) {
600 if (op.Is<PhiOp>()) {
601 CreateOldToNewMapping(index, new_phi_values[phi_num++]);
602 continue;
603 }
604 }
605 // Blocks with a single predecessor (for which CanHavePhis might be kNo)
606 // can still have phis if they used to be loop header that were turned
607 // into regular blocks.
608 DCHECK_IMPLIES(op.Is<PhiOp>(), op.input_count == 1);
609
610 if (!VisitOpAndUpdateMapping<trace_reduction>(index, input_block)) {
611 stopped_early = true;
612 break;
613 }
614 }
615 // If the last operation of the loop above (= the one-before-last operation
616 // of the block) was lowered to an unconditional deopt/trap/something like
617 // that, then current_block will now be null, and there is no need visit the
618 // last operation of the block.
619 if (stopped_early || Asm().current_block() == nullptr) return;
620
621 // The final operation (which should be a block terminator) of the block
622 // is processed separately, because if it's a Goto to a block with a
623 // single predecessor, we'll inline it. (we could have had a check `if (op
624 // is a Goto)` in the loop above, but since this can only be true for the
625 // last operation, we instead extracted it here to make things faster).
626 const Operation& terminator =
627 input_block->LastOperation(Asm().input_graph());
628 DCHECK(terminator.IsBlockTerminator());
629 VisitBlockTerminator<trace_reduction>(terminator, input_block);
630 }
631
632 template <bool trace_reduction>
633 bool VisitOpAndUpdateMapping(OpIndex index, const Block* input_block) {
634 if (Asm().current_block() == nullptr) return false;
635 OpIndex new_index =
636 VisitOpNoMappingUpdate<trace_reduction>(index, input_block);
637 const Operation& op = Asm().input_graph().Get(index);
638 if (CanBeUsedAsInput(op) && new_index.valid()) {
639 CreateOldToNewMapping(index, new_index);
640 }
641 return true;
642 }
643
644 template <bool trace_reduction>
645 OpIndex VisitOpNoMappingUpdate(OpIndex index, const Block* input_block) {
646 Block* current_block = Asm().current_block();
647 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(current_block);
648 Asm().SetCurrentOrigin(index);
649 current_block->SetOrigin(input_block);
650 OpIndex first_output_index = Asm().output_graph().next_operation_index();
651 USE(first_output_index);
652 const Operation& op = Asm().input_graph().Get(index);
653 if constexpr (trace_reduction) TraceReductionStart(index);
654 if (ShouldSkipOperation(op)) {
655 if constexpr (trace_reduction) TraceOperationSkipped();
656 return OpIndex::Invalid();
657 }
658 OpIndex new_index;
659 switch (op.opcode) {
660#define EMIT_INSTR_CASE(Name) \
661 case Opcode::k##Name: \
662 if (MayThrow(Opcode::k##Name)) return OpIndex::Invalid(); \
663 new_index = Asm().ReduceInputGraph##Name(index, op.Cast<Name##Op>()); \
664 break;
665 TURBOSHAFT_OPERATION_LIST(EMIT_INSTR_CASE)
666#undef EMIT_INSTR_CASE
667 }
668 if constexpr (trace_reduction) {
669 if (CanBeUsedAsInput(op) && !new_index.valid()) {
670 TraceOperationSkipped();
671 } else {
672 TraceReductionResult(current_block, first_output_index, new_index);
673 }
674 }
675#ifdef DEBUG
676 DCHECK_IMPLIES(new_index.valid(),
677 Asm().output_graph().BelongsToThisGraph(new_index));
678 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.turboshaft_verify_reductions)) {
679 if (new_index.valid()) {
680 const Operation& new_op = Asm().output_graph().Get(new_index);
681 if (!new_op.Is<TupleOp>()) {
682 // Checking that the outputs_rep of the new operation are the same as
683 // the old operation. (except for tuples, since they don't have
684 // outputs_rep)
685 DCHECK_EQ(new_op.outputs_rep().size(), op.outputs_rep().size());
686 for (size_t i = 0; i < new_op.outputs_rep().size(); ++i) {
687 DCHECK(new_op.outputs_rep()[i].AllowImplicitRepresentationChangeTo(
688 op.outputs_rep()[i],
689 Asm().output_graph().IsCreatedFromTurbofan()));
690 }
691 }
692 Asm().Verify(index, new_index);
693 }
694 }
695#endif // DEBUG
696 return new_index;
697 }
698
699 template <bool trace_reduction>
700 void VisitBlockTerminator(const Operation& terminator,
701 const Block* input_block) {
702 if (Asm().CanAutoInlineBlocksWithSinglePredecessor() &&
703 terminator.Is<GotoOp>()) {
704 Block* destination = terminator.Cast<GotoOp>().destination;
705 if (destination->PredecessorCount() == 1) {
706 block_to_inline_now_ = destination;
707 return;
708 }
709 }
710 // Just going through the regular VisitOp function.
711 OpIndex index = Asm().input_graph().Index(terminator);
712 VisitOpAndUpdateMapping<trace_reduction>(index, input_block);
713 }
714
715 template <bool trace_reduction>
716 void ProcessWaitingCloningAndInlining() {
717 InlineWaitingBlock<trace_reduction>();
718 while (!blocks_to_clone_.empty()) {
719 BlockToClone item = blocks_to_clone_.back();
720 blocks_to_clone_.pop_back();
721 DoCloneBlock<trace_reduction>(
722 item.input_block, item.added_block_phi_input, item.new_output_block);
723 InlineWaitingBlock<trace_reduction>();
724 }
725 }
726
727 template <bool trace_reduction>
728 void InlineWaitingBlock() {
729 while (block_to_inline_now_) {
730 Block* input_block = block_to_inline_now_;
731 block_to_inline_now_ = nullptr;
732 ScopedModification<bool> set_true(&current_block_needs_variables_, true);
733 if constexpr (trace_reduction) {
734 std::cout << "Inlining " << PrintAsBlockHeader{*input_block} << "\n";
735 }
736 VisitBlockBody<CanHavePhis::kNo, ForCloning::kNo, trace_reduction>(
737 input_block);
738 }
739 }
740
741 template <bool trace_reduction>
742 void DoCloneBlock(const Block* input_block, int added_block_phi_input,
743 Block* output_block) {
744 DCHECK_EQ(output_block->PredecessorCount(), 1);
745 if constexpr (trace_reduction) {
746 std::cout << "\nCloning old " << PrintAsBlockHeader{*input_block} << "\n";
747 std::cout << "As new "
748 << PrintAsBlockHeader{*output_block,
749 Asm().output_graph().next_block_index()}
750 << "\n";
751 }
752
753 ScopedModification<bool> set_true(&current_block_needs_variables_, true);
754
755 Asm().BindReachable(output_block);
756 VisitBlockBody<CanHavePhis::kYes, ForCloning::kYes, trace_reduction>(
757 input_block, added_block_phi_input);
758
759 if constexpr (trace_reduction) TraceBlockFinished();
760 }
761
762 void TraceReductionStart(OpIndex index) {
763 std::cout << " o" << index.id() << ": "
764 << PaddingSpace{5 - CountDecimalDigits(index.id())}
765 << OperationPrintStyle{Asm().input_graph().Get(index), "#o"}
766 << "\n";
767 }
768 void TraceOperationSkipped() { std::cout << "> skipped\n\n"; }
769 void TraceBlockUnreachable() { std::cout << "> unreachable\n\n"; }
770 void TraceReductionResult(Block* current_block, OpIndex first_output_index,
771 OpIndex new_index) {
772 if (new_index < first_output_index) {
773 // The operation was replaced with an already existing one.
774 std::cout << "> #n" << new_index.id() << "\n";
775 }
776 bool before_arrow = new_index >= first_output_index;
777 for (const Operation& op : Asm().output_graph().operations(
778 first_output_index, Asm().output_graph().next_operation_index())) {
779 OpIndex index = Asm().output_graph().Index(op);
780 const char* prefix;
781 if (index == new_index) {
782 prefix = ">";
783 before_arrow = false;
784 } else if (before_arrow) {
785 prefix = " ";
786 } else {
787 prefix = " ";
788 }
789 std::cout << prefix << " n" << index.id() << ": "
790 << PaddingSpace{5 - CountDecimalDigits(index.id())}
791 << OperationPrintStyle{Asm().output_graph().Get(index), "#n"}
792 << "\n";
793 if (op.IsBlockTerminator() && Asm().current_block() &&
794 Asm().current_block() != current_block) {
795 current_block = &Asm().output_graph().Get(
796 BlockIndex(current_block->index().id() + 1));
797 std::cout << "new " << PrintAsBlockHeader{*current_block} << "\n";
798 }
799 }
800 std::cout << "\n";
801 }
802 void TraceBlockFinished() { std::cout << "\n"; }
803
804 // These functions take an operation from the old graph and use the assembler
805 // to emit a corresponding operation in the new graph, translating inputs and
806 // blocks accordingly.
807 V8_INLINE OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphGoto(const GotoOp& op) {
808 Block* destination = MapToNewGraph(op.destination);
809 if (op.is_backedge) {
810 DCHECK(destination->IsBound());
811 DCHECK(destination->IsLoop());
812 FixLoopPhis(op.destination);
813 }
814 // It is important that we first fix loop phis and then reduce the `Goto`,
815 // because reducing the `Goto` can have side effects, in particular, it can
816 // modify affect the SnapshotTable of `VariableReducer`, which is also used
817 // by `FixLoopPhis()`.
818 Asm().ReduceGoto(destination, op.is_backedge);
819 return OpIndex::Invalid();
820 }
821 V8_INLINE OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphBranch(const BranchOp& op) {
822 Block* if_true = MapToNewGraph(op.if_true);
823 Block* if_false = MapToNewGraph(op.if_false);
824 return Asm().ReduceBranch(MapToNewGraph(op.condition()), if_true, if_false,
825 op.hint);
826 }
827 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphSwitch(const SwitchOp& op) {
828 base::SmallVector<SwitchOp::Case, 16> cases;
829 for (SwitchOp::Case c : op.cases) {
830 cases.emplace_back(c.value, MapToNewGraph(c.destination), c.hint);
831 }
832 return Asm().ReduceSwitch(
833 MapToNewGraph(op.input()),
834 Asm().graph_zone()->CloneVector(base::VectorOf(cases)),
835 MapToNewGraph(op.default_case), op.default_hint);
836 }
837 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphPhi(const PhiOp& op) {
838 return ResolvePhi(
839 op,
840 [this](OpIndex ind, int predecessor_index) {
841 return MapToNewGraph(ind, predecessor_index);
842 },
843 op.rep);
844 }
845 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphPendingLoopPhi(const PendingLoopPhiOp& op) {
846 UNREACHABLE();
847 }
848 V8_INLINE OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphFrameState(const FrameStateOp& op) {
849 auto inputs = MapToNewGraph<32>(op.inputs());
850 return Asm().ReduceFrameState(base::VectorOf(inputs), op.inlined, op.data);
851 }
852 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphCall(const CallOp& op) {
853 OpIndex callee = MapToNewGraph(op.callee());
854 OptionalOpIndex frame_state = MapToNewGraph(op.frame_state());
855 auto arguments = MapToNewGraph<16>(op.arguments());
856 return Asm().ReduceCall(callee, frame_state, base::VectorOf(arguments),
857 op.descriptor, op.Effects());
858 }
859 OpIndex AssembleOutputGraphDidntThrow(const DidntThrowOp& op) {
860 const Operation& throwing_operation =
861 Asm().input_graph().Get(op.throwing_operation());
862 OpIndex result;
863 switch (throwing_operation.opcode) {
864#define CASE(Name) \
865 case Opcode::k##Name: \
866 result = Asm().ReduceInputGraph##Name( \
867 op.throwing_operation(), throwing_operation.Cast<Name##Op>()); \
868 break;
869 TURBOSHAFT_THROWING_OPERATIONS_LIST(CASE)
870#undef CASE
871 default:
872 UNREACHABLE();
873 }
874 return result;
875 }
876
877 V<None> AssembleOutputGraphCheckException(const CheckExceptionOp& op) {
878 Graph::OpIndexIterator it(op.didnt_throw_block->begin(),
879 &Asm().input_graph());
880 Graph::OpIndexIterator end(op.didnt_throw_block->end(),
881 &Asm().input_graph());
882 // To translate `CheckException` to the new graph, we reduce the throwing
883 // operation (actually it's `DidntThrow` operation, but that triggers the
884 // actual reduction) with a catch scope. If the reduction replaces the
885 // throwing operation with other throwing operations, all of them will be
886 // connected to the provided catch block. The reduction should automatically
887 // bind a block that represents non-throwing control flow of the original
888 // operation, so we can inline the rest of the `didnt_throw` block.
889 {
890 CatchScope scope(Asm(), MapToNewGraph(op.catch_block));
891 DCHECK(Asm().input_graph().Get(*it).template Is<DidntThrowOp>());
892 if (!Asm().InlineOp(*it, op.didnt_throw_block)) {
893 return V<None>::Invalid();
894 }
895 ++it;
896 }
897 for (; it != end; ++it) {
898 // Using `InlineOp` requires that the inlined operation is not emitted
899 // multiple times. This is the case here because we just removed the
900 // single predecessor of `didnt_throw_block`.
901 if (!Asm().InlineOp(*it, op.didnt_throw_block)) {
902 break;
903 }
904 }
905 return V<None>::Invalid();
906 }
907
908 void CreateOldToNewMapping(OpIndex old_index, OpIndex new_index) {
909 DCHECK(old_index.valid());
910 DCHECK(Asm().input_graph().BelongsToThisGraph(old_index));
911 DCHECK_IMPLIES(new_index.valid(),
912 Asm().output_graph().BelongsToThisGraph(new_index));
913
914 if (current_block_needs_variables_) {
915 MaybeVariable var = GetVariableFor(old_index);
916 if (!var.has_value()) {
917 MaybeRegisterRepresentation rep =
918 Asm().input_graph().Get(old_index).outputs_rep().size() == 1
919 ? static_cast<const MaybeRegisterRepresentation&>(
920 Asm().input_graph().Get(old_index).outputs_rep()[0])
921 : MaybeRegisterRepresentation::None();
922 var = Asm().NewLoopInvariantVariable(rep);
923 SetVariableFor(old_index, *var);
924 }
925 Asm().SetVariable(*var, new_index);
926 return;
927 }
928
929 DCHECK(!op_mapping_[old_index].valid());
930 op_mapping_[old_index] = new_index;
931 }
932
933 MaybeVariable GetVariableFor(OpIndex old_index) const {
934 return old_opindex_to_variables[old_index];
935 }
936
937 void SetVariableFor(OpIndex old_index, MaybeVariable var) {
938 DCHECK(!old_opindex_to_variables[old_index].has_value());
939 old_opindex_to_variables[old_index] = var;
940 }
941
942 void FixLoopPhis(Block* input_graph_loop) {
943 DCHECK(input_graph_loop->IsLoop());
944 Block* output_graph_loop = MapToNewGraph(input_graph_loop);
945 DCHECK(output_graph_loop->IsLoop());
946 for (const Operation& op : Asm().input_graph().operations(
947 input_graph_loop->begin(), input_graph_loop->end())) {
948 if (auto* input_phi = op.TryCast<PhiOp>()) {
949 OpIndex phi_index =
950 MapToNewGraph<true>(Asm().input_graph().Index(*input_phi));
951 if (!phi_index.valid() || !output_graph_loop->Contains(phi_index)) {
952 // Unused phis are skipped, so they are not be mapped to anything in
953 // the new graph. If the phi is reduced to an operation from a
954 // different block, then there is no loop phi in the current loop
955 // header to take care of.
956 continue;
957 }
958 Asm().FixLoopPhi(*input_phi, phi_index, output_graph_loop);
959 }
960 }
961 }
962
963 Graph& input_graph_;
964
965 const Block* current_input_block_;
966
967 // Mappings from old OpIndices to new OpIndices.
968 FixedOpIndexSidetable<OpIndex> op_mapping_;
969
970 // Mappings from old blocks to new blocks.
971 FixedBlockSidetable<Block*> block_mapping_;
972
973 // {current_block_needs_variables_} is set to true if the current block should
974 // use Variables to map old to new OpIndex rather than just {op_mapping}. This
975 // is typically the case when the block has been cloned.
976 bool current_block_needs_variables_ = false;
977
978 // When {turn_loop_without_backedge_into_merge_} is true (the default), when
979 // processing an input block that ended with a loop backedge but doesn't
980 // anymore, the loop header is turned into a regular merge. This can be turned
981 // off when unrolling a loop for instance.
982 bool turn_loop_without_backedge_into_merge_ = true;
983
984 // Set of Blocks for which Variables should be used rather than
985 // {op_mapping}.
986 BitVector blocks_needing_variables_;
987
988 // Mapping from old OpIndex to Variables.
989 FixedOpIndexSidetable<MaybeVariable> old_opindex_to_variables;
990
991 // When the last operation of a Block is a Goto to a Block with a single
992 // predecessor, we always inline the destination into the current block. To
993 // avoid making this process recursive (which could lead to stack overflows),
994 // we set the variable {block_to_inline_now_} instead. Right after we're done
995 // visiting a Block, the function ProcessWaitingCloningAndInlining will inline
996 // {block_to_inline_now_} (if it's set) in a non-recursive way.
997 Block* block_to_inline_now_ = nullptr;
998
999 // When a Reducer wants to clone a block (for instance,
1000 // BranchEliminationReducer, in order to remove Phis or to replace a Branch by
1001 // a Goto), this block is not cloned right away, in order to avoid recursion
1002 // (which could lead to stack overflows). Instead, we add this block to
1003 // {blocks_to_clone_}. Right after we're done visiting a Block, the function
1004 // ProcessWaitingCloningAndInlining will actually clone the blocks in
1005 // {blocks_to_clone_} in a non-recursive way.
1006 struct BlockToClone {
1007 const Block* input_block;
1008 int added_block_phi_input;
1009 Block* new_output_block;
1010 };
1011 ZoneVector<BlockToClone> blocks_to_clone_;
1012
1013#ifdef DEBUG
1014 // Recursively inlining blocks is still allowed (mainly for
1015 // LoopUnrollingReducer), but it shouldn't be actually recursive. This is
1016 // checked by the {is_in_recursive_inlining_}, which is set to true while
1017 // recursively inlining a block. Trying to inline a block while
1018 // {is_in_recursive_inlining_} is true will lead to a DCHECK failure.
1019 bool is_in_recursive_inlining_ = false;
1020#endif
1021};
1022
1023template <template <class> class... Reducers>
1024class TSAssembler;
1025
1026template <template <class> class... Reducers>
1027class CopyingPhaseImpl {
1028 public:
1029 static void Run(PipelineData* data, Graph& input_graph, Zone* phase_zone,
1030 bool trace_reductions = false) {
1031 TSAssembler<GraphVisitor, Reducers...> phase(
1032 data, input_graph, input_graph.GetOrCreateCompanion(), phase_zone);
1033#ifdef DEBUG
1034 if (trace_reductions) {
1035 phase.template VisitGraph<true>();
1036 } else {
1037 phase.template VisitGraph<false>();
1038 }
1039#else
1040 phase.template VisitGraph<false>();
1041#endif // DEBUG
1042 }
1043};
1044
1045template <template <typename> typename... Reducers>
1046class CopyingPhase {
1047 public:
1048 static void Run(PipelineData* data, Zone* phase_zone) {
1049 Graph& input_graph = data->graph();
1050 CopyingPhaseImpl<Reducers...>::Run(
1051 data, input_graph, phase_zone,
1052 data->info()->turboshaft_trace_reduction());
1053 }
1054};
1055
1056} // namespace v8::internal::compiler::turboshaft
1057
1058#endif // V8_COMPILER_TURBOSHAFT_COPYING_PHASE_H_
